boardgame.description: The game board in Heimlich _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Co. is an oval movement track, with points allocated to the various spaces. Seven differently colored _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;spies_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; are placed on the board. On a player's turn, he rolls a dice, then moves any combination of characters forward that number of spaces. The newly-moved spies then score points based on their new location. However, the trick here is that each player's color isn't known until the end of the game, so players are encouraged to deduce which color belongs to whom._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Heimlich _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Co. includes advanced rules which allow players to score more points at the end of the game for correctly guessing everyone's identity. (_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Heimlich_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, by the way, is a German adjective meaning secretly and slyly, so Heimlich _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Co. translates as Clandestine and Company!)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2002 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Foreign Game for Beginners Nominee

For purchase by James Engelhardt only. Shipping is FedEx. Winner of the Spiel des Jahres for 1986. Contents and box are clean, undamaged, and complete. Our family liked the game so much, this was our 2nd box. This is the German version, 1986 Ravensburger, and I copied the rules from our 1st edition and included them with this box. There are no words used on the board, cards, or anywhere--this game uses graphics only.

Box is well scuffed, but the game is fine. This is the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Heimlich _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Co._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; edition, in English. It has no _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Top Secret_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; cards, and the die is a standard d6. The die is easy enough to work around if you prefer the newer rules: a player who rolls a 1 can treat it as a 1, 2, or 3 (or 0 in the new variant). Both rulebooks are published on the Geek. The rules I have are _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Under Cover.pdf_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, Rio Grande_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s is _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;TopSecretSpies(Heimlich_US).pdf_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;

KK Boardgames ~ supplier-direct games ~ your Canadian and US source for discount game prices based in Vancouver, BC and Blaine, WA. All prices in USD and all games are new and in shrink unless otherwise stated. For Canadian customers who want to pay in CAD, we can convert to CAD based on the current exchange rate. Top Secret Spies - $27.96 Availability: DIRECT ORDER - In stock at our supplier. *** Usually ships in 1-2 weeks ***. If you place an order, we will include the game in our next order from our supplier* *Next order date - to see our next order date click on the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;More info..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; link. If the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;More info..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; link is not visible, click on the user ID _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;kkrieger_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; to view our _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;geekstore_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;, then click on the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;More info..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; link for a specific game. SHIPPING: We are near the US/Canada border so we can ship from either country -- there are absolutely no customs fees for US and Canada orders! For Canadian orders, we ship with Canada Post and charge a flat rate for one game (based on your province, see below) + $1.50 for each additional game (up to a maximum of an additional $6). e.g. The 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th games ship for $1.50 each, all subsequent games ship for free. Metro Vancouver area $8.50 (1 business day) or $0.00* Victoria (South Vancouver Island) $10 (2 business days) BC $12 (2 business days) AB $13 (2 business days) SK $13 (3 business days) MB $14 (3 business days) ON $15 (4 business days) QC $15 (5 business days) PE,NB,NS $15 (7 business days) NL $17 (8 business days) YT $17 (5 business days) NU/NT/Remote areas $17 (up to 13 business days) *FREE local pick-up in Vancouver area. US Orders are shipped USPS from zipcode 98230. International Orders are shipped USPS Priority Mail International with insurance and return receipt. PROMOTIONS: Loyalty rewards: For every $50 of games on your order, receive a $2.50 credit to be used on a future order. PAYMENT METHODS: We accept the following forms of payment: 1. Interac e-Transfer* (Canadian banks) 2. Cash on delivery (local pick-up greater Vancouver area) 3. PayPal (Instant Transfer or debit/credit card funded) 4. Credit cards (processed by PayPal - your information is never shared with us) 5. Money Order - we will accept postal money orders, but will not ship games until money order is received and cashed. Our prices include a discount for paying cash or another no fee method (1-2 above). All payments processed by PayPal (3-4 above) will incur an extra charge of $0.30 + 2.9% to pass on the exact processing costs charged to us by PayPal. International payments through PayPal are $0.30 + 3.9%. We will provide detailed payment instructions for you once the order is placed. CONTACT US: Although we will make an effort to respond to all questions via geekmail as quickly as possible, your response time will be faster if you send questions via email to kkboardgames+bgg@gmail.com
